attributes.action: Provide legal aid to the families of the Hercules shot down in Iraq in January 2005
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Families of nine UK personnel killed in a plane shot down in Iraq will get no legal aid at an inquest.

All 10 onboard the Wiltshire-based Hercules died when it was shot down in January 2005, in the biggest single UK loss of life in the Iraq conflict.

The Australian government will PAY for a lawyer for relatives of Flt Lt Paul Pardoel at the inquest in March.

Whether you believe the conflict in Irag is right or wrong the families of the Air Crew should not be subject to further distress or concerns as to the conduct or findings of any inquest and the Government should accord the families the same respect as that of the Australian government.
